string.value: Did you forget? You're not in any games at the moment!
{0} has started a game! Join to have so much fun you'll even forget who you are!
A new game has been started by {0}! Join to get eaten by amnesiac wolves!
{0} has started a chaos game! Join to take part in the confusion!
A new chaos game has been started by {0}! Join to get killed by accident!
You forgot to join while the game hadn't started yet! Use /nextgame and I'll notify you once a new game starts so you won't forget about it again!
You've already joined, remember?
1 minute left to join, don't forget about it!
{0} seconds left to join
Everyone forgot about this group... We didn't reach 5 players, cancelling game!

Game is starting, please wait while I assign roles and update the database. Something strange is happening to the village! For some reason, no one can seem to remember who they are... (roles will not be revealed to their players!) These roles are possible to be assigned for this game:
{0} is banned for attempting an exploit (no names starting with /)
{0}, did you forget to change your name? Please do that, otherwise you can't join!
Sorry, max player limit has been reached! Remember to try again on the /nextgame!
{0} forgot who they are! {1} amnesiacs, {2} minimum, {3} max
{0}, you forgot to PM the bot first! Click the button below or this: {1}, then click start. If you don't, the bot will forget you wanted to play...
Did you even forget you're dead? Dead don't run away...
{0} forgot about his family and friends in the village and has fled in terror!
{0} had forgotten, but was {1}
{0} amnesiacs remain.
You don't even know who you are but you already want to do something? Take a breath! I didn't ask you anything yet!
Did you forget? You can't do that unless you're playing!
Looks like I've forgotten who you're talking about... I can't find a player by that name!
Did you forget how to play too? This answer is not valid!
{0} has voted to do something to {1}
{0} has voted to lynch {1}
{0} has forgotten to vote 2 nights in a row. Forgetting about this game is so bad that {0} forgot how to breathe too, and died. {1}
Your role changed, but from what, and to what?
Choice accepted
\nYou may not remember who you are, but you do remember someone important: {0}
{0} is dead! Your role changed, but from what, and to what?
You start to forget a name... What was it, {1}? Wait... What were you thinking about, again? Amidst the names in your head, a new one appears: {0}!
You may not remember for sure who you are, but at least now you know this: {0} is {1}!
Who do you want to lynch?
You know you should be doing something to someone, but who should you choose? And why is the number 2 stuck in your head?

Dusk draws near, and the village gathers to decide who should... forget to breathe this time. Everyone now has {0} seconds to vote!
It is now day time. All of you have {0} seconds to try and find out your role... And if you manage to, everyone else's!
Night has fallen. Everyone heads to bed, hoping to wake up with all their memories. Night players: you have {0} seconds to use your actions!
The villagers have cast their votes, hoping to have made the best choice even with so little information. {0} is dead. {1}
Unable to come up with a proper decision on who to lynch, the mob returns to their homes for the night, frustrated...
Looks like everyone forgot to vote! No lynchmob tonight...

The villagers gather in the morning, but do not see {0}. They wander over to the house, only to find a disembowelled corpse. When searching for the culprit, they find two old and rusty badges strewn on the floor... Why were there two badges? Maybe even the late owner was trying to remember...
Morning comes, and, to everyone's dismay, there's a completely broken corpse near the church's door, its wings bent in unnatural directions. The face can still be recognized, though: {0} is dead.

As everyone comes out of their houses, they find pieces of a shotgun strewn about... then legs... then fingers... then floating in the fountain in the town square, the body of {0}, dead from a werewolf attack. You have lost your gunner.
The villagers awake in the morning, to find the disembowelled remains of {0} haunched over a ouija board and tarot cards. The Seer is dead.
Everyone wakes to the smell of burning alcohol and wood... the pub is on fire! After putting the fire out, the remains of {0} are found, torn apart...
As the sun rises above the village, they find {0} slumped over an ouija board, but with a deck of... memory game cards? What a strange combination...

As everyone rises in the morning, they smell a terrible stink. They follow the smell to find {0} shredded apart in the pig pen, head missing. After investigating the now-vacant house to find out something about the culprit, the village finally realizes that {1}
A noticeable stench is coming from {0}'s house... the village inspects it to find a body lying in front of a dark altar... a cultist has been killed by the hunter!
The villagers gather the next morning in the village center, to sighs of relief - it appears there was no attack the previous night.

Oh no! The wolves ate you. NOMNOMNOMNOM

{0} wasn't home!
{0} was a wolf! You got eaten...
{0} slipped into the wrong house last night! Their remains are found in front of the church door...
{0} slips into {1}'s house, ready to have a little fun to ease off the stress. However, they instead find a werewolf eating {1}! The werewolf quickly turns on {0} and jumps... {0} is dead.
Did something happen at {0}'s house last night? You can't seem to remember...

You may not remember for sure who you are, but at least now you know this: {0} is the Detective 🕵!
You may not remember for sure who you are, but at least now you know this: {0} is {1}!
Suddenly, a shot rings out. The village turns to see {0} standing over {1}'s body, a gun still aimed at the head. {1} was the Harlot 💋
Suddenly, a shot rings out. The village turns to see {0} standing over {1}'s body, a gun still aimed at the head. {2}
The werewolf has won!
The werewolves have won!
The villagers have won! All of their enemies have died...
Oh no! You lynched the Tanner! Didn't expect that, huh?
Suddenly, the survivors remembered everything! Their names, roles and teams were:

Everyone wakes up in the morning, and notices that {0} is not around... They check the house to find the remains of {0}.
As the villagers gather as the sun rises, the find the remains of {0}, who died somehow last night...

The village has chosen to hang you! The fear of death makes you regain some clarity, and you know what to do... This is your last chance, choose to shoot someone as you go down!
{0} fumbles for their pistol as the noose tightens, but cannot get it in time, and falls to their death with a loud snap of their neck...
{0} whips out their pistol, looks at the crowd... and cannot make a decision on who to shoot. They fall to their death, accepting their fate...
As the noose tightens around {0}'s neck, they whip out a pistol, arm it, take aim, and pull the trigger, shooting {1} as the floor drops out beneath them! {1} falls over, dead. {2}
You've been deathly wounded! The fear of death makes you regain some clarity, and you know what to do... This is your last chance, choose to shoot someone as you go down!
{0}'s wound was too much, so much that they couldn't even reach for their sidearm, as they lay in a pool of blood...
As {0} lays there, gasping for their final breath, they can't decide who to shoot... and accept their fate...
As {0} is deathly wounded, they fall to the ground... but not without grasping their pistol, and firing upon {1}, who takes a bullet right between the eyes. {2}
{0} went to {1}'s house and is now dead!
The wolves attacked the hunter last night, but were met with a fight... The hunter may have died, but {0} died too!
The wolf tried to attack the hunter last night, but the hunter was able to take the wolf {0} down with their rifle!
The wolves attempted to have a nice late night snack, but were instead greeted by a crazed murderer! {0} was killed in the fight!

It seemed a quiet enough night for {0}, but they were wrong. The villagers gather in the morning to find {0} split from head to toe, but oddly the liver was missing... The serial killer has struck again! {1}
Did something happen at {0}'s house last night? You can't seem to remember...
{0} went to {1}'s house and is now dead!
You went to the serial killer's house! You were killed.
{0} was the serial killer! You were killed.
The village sees {0}'s body, lying dead in the public square with countless stab wounds. {0} is dead.

The only person left standing is the serial killer! They have won!

With {0}'s dying breath, {1} rushes over and falls, crying. They cannot stand the loss of their loved one, and shoot themselves with the nearest pistol the can find. {2}

True love endures! The lovers have won!
In the middle of the town square, everyone finds the body of {0}, multiple shots to the body. Looks like they tried to sneak up on the Hunter! {1}
Did something happen last night? You can't seem to remember...
Did you forget? You are already on the wait list for {0}!
You have been added to the wait list for {0}. Don't worry, I won't forget to PM you when the next game is starting!
A new game is starting in {0}! Don't forget to join!
Morning comes, and the remaining two villagers walk out to the town square. {0} takes a look at {1}, gets a big grin on their face, pulls out a knife, and takes {1} out.
Everyone in the village has died... there's nothing but bodies left. No one wins this round, except the vultures...

As the sun rises, {0} and {1} walk out into the village. {0} pulls out their knife, and jumps at {1}. {1} pulls out a pistol and fires a shot into {0}'s face as {0} lands, plunging the knife deep into {1}. Both are dead, the village is empty, there is no winner...
You forgot to make a choice, so the moderator has chosen for you: {0}
Won
Lost
Player {0} forgot to vote and has been killed because of it {1} times in the past 24 hours.

Every player is a villager, able to vote every day to try and lynch the village's enemies (or their own...), but some people are nothing other than villagers! In that case, they won't have any actions for the whole game (other than the lynch vote), and their deaths will only make a difference as another number.
NO ACTIONS, ever!

The Seer may choose a player every night, and will find out their role once morning comes. Careful when revealing what you've found out to others, though: lots of people in the villager want a Seer dead... Trust no one, not even yourself: you may be the fool! (/aboutfool) When looking at the Traitor, there's a 50% chance of seeing them as either a villager or a wolf.
NIGHT ACTIONS, every night!

Every night, all wolves in the pack vote to decide who to attack. Not all players should be attacked, though! The newest wolf in a pack will be killed if the Serial Killer is attacked, and may be killed if the target is the Hunter (30% chance for a sole wolf to die - and not be able to kill the Hunter! - and an additional 20% chance for the newest wolf to die for each additional wolf in the pack!) All wolves will get drunk if they attack the Village Drunk, and won't be able to do any actions the next night! The Harlot probably won't be home, so the night will be wasted if you try to attack them! Good news, though: if you attack the cursed, they will become a wolf along with you! If you kill a Wild Child's rolemodel, they will also become a wolf! \nIf you attack the drunk, you yourself will become drunk, and will be unable to do the next attack as you sleep off your hangover! (Usually, this means you can't attack the following night, but if the Wolf Cub was killed and the Drunk was your first choice, you won't be able to kill the second player, and you will still be able to attack the following night.)
NIGHT ACTIONS, every night!

The Harlot will be given the chance to visit another player each night. They will notice something happened, even if they don't remember what. The harlot dies if they visit a wolf or the Serial Killer, so visiting is a good way to find safe players, even if it's as a sacrifice! The harlot will also die if they visit a house attacked by the wolves or if the Serial Killer chooses to kill them! When visiting a cultist, the harlot has a 50% chance of finding out their role!
NIGHT ACTIONS, every night!

The Drunk is just like a villager... Except when they're killed by wolves! Then the wolves will become drunk too, and unable to attack next time!
NO ACTIONS, ever!

The Cursed is just like a villager... Until they're attacked by the wolves! Then they become a wolf as well, and join the pack!
NO ACTIONS, until their role changes!

strings.string:
The Traitor is just like a villager... Until all wolves die! Then they take over the mantle and become a werewolf, ready to attack the villagers! When the Seer looks at the Traitor, there's a 50% chance of the traitor appearing as either a villager or a wolf.
NO ACTIONS, until their role changes!

string.value:
The Guardian Angel can choose one player each night to protect from attacks, either from wolves or the Serial Killer. However, if they choose to protect one of those they should protect from, they may be killed!
NIGHT ACTIONS, every night!

Every day, the Detective can choose a player to investigate, and will find out what their role is. There is a 40% chance the werewolves will see the Detective investigating someone, though!
DAY ACTIONS, every day!

strings.string:
During the day, the Gunner will be given the chance to shoot (and kill!) another player. The whole village will know who did it, so they will (probably) not lynch the Gunner, knowing they're on the villagers' side! There are only two bullets on their gun, though...
DAY ACTIONS, but it can only be used twice!

string.value:
The Tanner is just like a villager... But if they're lynched, they win the game!
NO ACTIONS, ever!

The Fool has no way of knowing they aren't actually the Seer... When choosing a player to find out their role, they will instead get told a random role out of all roles of alive players.
NIGHT ACTIONS, every night!

Every night, all cultists in the cult vote to decide who to convert. The cult wins when every single alive player is a cultist. It's not that simple to convert players, though!
NIGHT ACTIONS, every night!

The Cultist Hunter has a single job: kill all cultists. Every night, they get to visit a player, who won't feel anything... unless they are a cultist, in which case, the Cultist Hunter will kill them! If the cult chooses to convert the CH, their newest member dies.
NIGHT ACTIONS, every night!

The Wild Child chooses a player as their rolemodel during the first night of the game. Once their role model dies, the Wild Child becomes a werewolf!
FIRST NIGHT ACTION, then none until their role changes!

The Apprentice Seer is just like a villager... Until the Seer dies, in which case, they will become the new Seer!
NO ACTIONS, until their role changes!

The Beholder is just like a villager, but, if there's a Seer in the game, they will be told their name. If the Seer dies and the Apprentice Seer and/or the Doppelgänger become Seer, the Beholder will also be told!
NO ACTIONS, but they do get information!

A mason is just like a villager, except they will always know who the other masons are! If a mason is converted to the cult, all other masons will be told!
NO ACTIONS, but they do get information!

The Doppelgänger chooses a player during the first night of the game. Once they die, the Doppelgänger will become what they were! Unless the player was converted to the cult, the Doppelgänger will become what they were at the time of death! When becoming a Wild Child, the Doppelgänger will inherit their role model. The Doppelgänger cannot be converted to a cultist until they change roles, and will not be able to win (except as a lover) unless they've changed roles!
FIRST NIGHT ACTION, then none until their role changes!

The Cupid will choose two players at the start of the game and make them fall in love with each other. If one of them dies, the other will die of sorrow... If one of them is on the winning team at the end of the game, both will be winners! If the only players left standing are the Lovers, they will be the winners! The Cupid can choose themselves as one of the Lovers.
FIRST NIGHT ACTIONS, then none!

The Hunter is just like a villager... Until someone visits them, or they die! Anyone who visits the Hunter's house will find themselves dead (other than the cult - there's a 50% chance the cult will convert the Hunter, and then a 50% chance a cultist will be killed if the conversion fails), unless they go there to attack the Hunter. The Serial Killer will be able to kill the Hunter, and a pack of wolves will also be able to do that... However, the Hunter won't go down without a fight! When they're killed - be it by lynching or a murder, but not a wolf attack - the Hunter will be given a choice to shoot and kill someone out of the players alive! Wolf attacks work differently, though! If a sole wolf attacks the hunter, there's a 30% chance they'll be able to kill the wolf and survive. Otherwise, the Hunter will be killed by the wolves, but may be able to take one down (instead of choosing a player to kill) as they go! For two wolves, the chance of killing one of them is 50%. For three, it's 70%; for four, 90%, and for packs with five wolves or more, the Hunter will definitely be able to kill one of them as they die!
NO ACTIONS, until they die!

The Serial Killer can choose a player every night to attack and kill. They win if they're the last one alive! There's no one that can't be killed by the Serial Killer, and visiting their house isn't a good idea, since everyone who tries will die... Serial Killers can only be killed by being lynched or shot (by the Gunner or the Hunter).
NIGHT ACTIONS, every night!

Para is a silly developer that likes to bark at people. Maybe he's been messing with werewolves too long....Messing with werewolves is a very bad idea.
ACTIONS AT EVERY TIME OF THE DAY... Para is busy!

As the village begins to lynch {0}, someone sees a ring in their finger, and screams for the village to stop. "STOP! That person is from the royal family! The royal ring is in his finger!" Fearful of being punished for hurting royalty, the village stops the lynching and retires for the night.
Did something happen at {0}'s house last night? You can't seem to remember...
{0} suddenly gasps, after taking something out of their pocket: the official seal of the Mayor. Everyone realizes he is the village's ruler, and, from now on, will count his vote twice when lynching.

As mayor, you are a lowly villager, until you reveal yourself. Then you are given twice the vote count for lynching (meaning that your vote is twice as powerful as everyone else's). Use that power wisely to help the Village Team.
The prince is a key role in the Villagers Team's strategy. Once it gets lynched, his role as Prince is revealed, and he survives. He then can only be killed at night, or by hunter.
Do you remember the good old seer ? Well now, it has it's Wolf Team counterpart. The sorcerer is the Wuff's Seer. They can only see if someone is Wolf or Seer, and they win with the Wolves.

You are the Clumsy Guy. Maybe you should not have had so much alcohol for breakfeast. You can't see a damn thing. Can you even vote for the person you want to ? (You have 50% chances to vote for someone random)

You are the BlackSmith. Through the years, no blades nor swords gave you as much satisfaction as the Silver Blades the elves ordered.\nYou might have some silverdust left. Who knows ? It might *prevent Wolves from eating tonight* ??
You are the Alpha Wolf, the origin of the curse, the bane of banes. Every night, there's 20% chance that you will bite your pack's meal, and they will join your ranks instead of dying!

What a cuuuute little wuff. _tickles tickles_ -cough cough- As i was saying, you are the Wolf Cub and you _drops the mic_ -I just can't resist that. I think if anyone killed you, i'd give the wuffs two victims. You're too cute to die. I wouldn't be able to tickle you anymore-

{0} went to {1}'s house and is now dead!

{0} slips into {1}'s house, ready for a night of passion, only to find a mysterious stranger surgically removing {1}'s innards! The serial killer decides to satisfy {0} before adding a slutty heart to their collection!
The villagers awake to find {0} hunched over a second-hand Ouija board while practising fortune-telling, with head missing. The Apprentice Seer is dead.

Seems like {0}, the resident blacksmith, must have been extremely unlucky. Five knives, fresh from {0}'s armory, were found plunged into his hands, feet and head, and pinned to the craftsman's table last night. Maybe the serial killer was hoping to expand his weapon collection alongside his organ one...
{0} was found stabbed to death with a candlestick by their altar. The serial killer has struck again, regardless of race, language or religion! {0} was a Cultist.
The next morning, the villagers were heartbroken to find {0} a.k.a. Cupid split from head to toe. Strangely the heart was missing...

The villagers had hoped to meet {0} to compliment his Martell, but all they found in {0}'s home was a broken knife and liver. All those years of drinking led to a liver so hard that even the Serial Killer probably does not fancy it...
{0} would normally have managed to fight off the serial killer, but it was an irony that the Guardian Angel's halo has extinguished. {0} is dead.

Looks like {0} was caught napping last night! A gunshot was heard last night, but all there was was the remains of a gunner, with a bullet hole to the head and a stab to the torso. Clearly the serial killer has won.

Assassination! {0} the mayor was found pinned with a knife on the table while working overnight at the mayor office! Clearly it's the serial killer exacting revenge for the asylum robbing him of years of his life!

Bells ring across the village before the sunrise, as armed guards flood the streets investigating the disappearance of Prince {0}. No clues were discovered, but it is suspected that there is a Serial Killer on the loose...

{0}'s guards were caught napping last night. The royal remains of {0} were found, hung in various parts of the palace, having fallen prey to the knife. No amount of princely blood would deter a serial killer's blade.

The villagers wake up to a rotting corpse of {0}, split from head to toe, stabs all over. Strangely the brain was carefully extricated, as if it was a premonition that the village has lost their top brains. {0} was the Seer.
The sound of mournful howls can be heard across the village. A mistake has been made. The wolves have killed one of their own. The Sorcerer {0} is dead.
Cries of "I'm your ally!" were heard last night. All the villagers found next morning were an exhumed body and smashed mystical ball, belonging to {0}, the sorcerer. Hunger trumps comradeship...

NOMNOMNOMNOM! The wolves were heard last night, eating up a tender Wild Child, {0}, leaving behind only a reduced-size skeleton! The village wondered if the wolves felt any guilt tearing apart the defenceless child.

The villagers wake up in the morning, only to find the severed body parts of {0}, the Cultist Hunter, in a cart placed in full view outside the town hall. Lesson learnt: don't visit the serial killer!
The body of {0}, the Cultist Hunter, was found in the middle of town, albeit cut precisely into a hundred pieces. Checking if the Serial Killer was a cultist does not seem to be a good idea...

While it seemed that the wolves decided to stay good for once, punishing {0}, a cultist that decided to court trouble with the wolves, proved too difficult to resist. {0}'s head was converted to a fine supper, delivered to the wolves' doorsteps!

The cult ran into unexpected trouble last night. Their newest member had the misfortune of visiting a wolf on the night the wolves decided to stay home, and the wolf found {0} quite delicious. Unfortunately for {0}, wolves have no interest in joining the new religious movement.

The cult thought they would have a new member in their ranks, but they were wrong! {0}, a cultist, was minced to pieces and placed at the town square in the morning! Strangely their "holy" book was found stabbed with a knife, as if a statement to show whose religion was triumphant.

Last night, the cult tried to convert the one person in the village crazier than they are. Their newest member tried to convert the Serial Killer, and the Serial Killer made a new piece of art in the town square of {0}'s internal organs.

It was supposed to be a night where {0} would save the village from the killers, but {0}'s halo was extinguished and wings sliced by the serial killer! Left was a note, "I could protect myself better than you can."
{0} tried to guard a wolf last night. The town woke up to find only the wings of {0} hung on the church cross. Clearly the wolves had an extra meal god-sent, free-of-charge, to their homes.

Knowing only {0} was left, {1} tries to eat {0} up, but {0}'s military training and paranoia proves too much to handle! All there is left is a carcass with two shots to the torso and the last man standing: the victorious hunter for the village!

Knowing only {0} was left, {1} chose a time where {0}'s guard was at their lowest. Eliminating the final villager proved to be effortless for {1}, for all there remains is a mutiliated body of {0}, the hunter, adorned with parallel slashes to the face.

{1} and {0} walk out in daylight. Seeing a shimmering cross worn around {0}'s neck, the righteous {1} draws their sword for the final time, putting an end to the twisted learnings of the cult that have contaminated the village.

As the sun starts to shine on the village, {0} wakes to the sound of silence. Realising there was no one left, {0} walks and walks, until they stand alone in the middle of the village. Looking at the sight of the corpses strewn all across the village, {0} sighs. Their lifelong dream of being chosen to be lynched by the villagers is as dead as the villagers are. They reach out and touch the rope, that had taken many lives, tenderly, before slipping it around their neck and letting themselves hang freely, with a sad smile on their face.

{0} wakes up at dawn, alone. {0} sees how abject a failure they has been, not being able to get the village to satisfy their masochistic desires of being lynched to death. {0} grabs a rope and hangs himself, realising no one can accomplish their dream, since there is no one left.

{0} opens their eyes, but instead of hearing the usual bustle of the village, they are met with silence. They stare at the dreary ceiling, letting reality slowly sink in. Everyone was dead. The wolves were dead. With a pang in their heart, {0} gets up, and packs their things, before walking to the edge of the village. A tear slips from their eye, as {0} recalls how close they and their wolves were to victory. Alas, it was time to start a new life, with a new pack. {0} slips into the darkness of the forest, away from the quiet village.

For all of {0}'s efforts, {0}'s wolf friends lay motionless and lifeless. Even if the wolves have been brought victory, there is no one to savour the success with, neither are there any living villagers to mock at. {0} peers into the crystal ball, and silently disappears, in a cloud of fog, in search of new wolves, new allies, and new treachery to commit new crimes against humanity.

The Snow Wolf 🐺☃️ is a wolf that was native to the snowcapped mountains near the village. As such, they have mastered the art of controlling ice and snow. Having lived alone for a long time, the Snow Wolf prefers to operate alone. Instead of hunting with their pack at night, they can pick a separate victim to freeze, which causes them to be unable to use their night actions. However, they will still have some residue of the Snow Wolf's magic the next night, causing them to be immune to the Snow Wolf for one night.

You are the Grave Digger ☠️. Every night, you dig the graves for all the people who died since the last time you did (yes, even werewolves deserve a proper burial). Since you are out all night, wolves and the cult can't find you, unless you actually have nothing to do (i.e. no one died), in that case you'll just stay home. Everyone who visits you has a chance of falling into your newly dug graves, depending on how many graves you dug. Also, the chance is halved for everyone who is on the village team with you. But since you are out at night, the wolves or the serial killer might spot and kill you, and the more graves you have to dig, the more likely it is. Also, apparently the serial killer can find you whether you're at home or not, but he might at least stumble in one of your graves and hurt his leg, causing him to maybe lose control over who is his victim the next night...

As the harlot {0} went home after a night of fun they tried to take a shortcut through the local graveyard. They must have been still a bit dizzy that they didn't see the uncovered grave until they felt no grounds under her next step. Maybe they should have taken that daytime job they got offered yesterday!

The cults tried to burn the church, but as {0} led the group through the graveyard, a bear trap snapped around his ankle! He screamed when he fell into an open grave and the other cultists fled in terror...

Maybe {0} the thief was trying to steal from the dead. Maybe it was karma. All we know is that he lurked around the graveyard when the trap snapped his leg. While falling into the grave, he wondered whether he should have brought a partner in crime for this job. {0} wont be stealing any more for sure!

As the wolf pack goes out for a hunt, {0} smells potential prey and doesn't notice the bear trap that snaps around their ankle! Surprised, {0} falls over into the grave, where the tip of a silver spear meets their head. Luckily the grave digger keeps his graves secured! {1}
